name: ElasticLoadBalancingConnectionDrainingPolicy
description: The ConnectionDrainingPolicy property describes how deregistered or unhealthy instances handle in-flight requests for the AWS::ElasticLoadBalancing::LoadBalancer resource. Connection draining ensures that the load balancer completes serving all in-flight requests made to a registered instance when the instance is deregistered or becomes unhealthy. Without connection draining, the load balancer closes connections to deregistered or unhealthy instances, and any in-flight requests are not completed.

properties.name: Enabled
properties.description: Whether or not connection draining is enabled for the load balancer.

properties.name: Timeout
properties.description: The time in seconds after the load balancer closes all connections to a deregistered or unhealthy instance.
